learning_outcomes.description: Use microeconomic theory to evaluate economic choices.
Analyse market structures using microeconomic theory.
Apply economics theory to make qualitative predictions.
Communicate findings using various digital modes.

assessments.due_date:
15/04/2026 10:00 am

Submission due on Blackboard via Turnitin at 10.00 AM.

See Blackboard for detailed submission instructions in due course.

Problem set will be released to students 24 hours in advance from the submission day/time.
assessments.task_description:
• You will be assessed on the topics covered in Lectures 1-6 (and tutorials 1-6).
  • Exercise I will be posted on Blackboard and needs to be submitted through Turnitin.
  • It will consist of problem solving questions and/or short questions.
  • Further details will be posted on Blackboard.

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Task

A simple “meet and greet” introductory activity to be completed in a collaborative platform: students must join a group and complete a simple activity (details on Blackboard).

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submissions instructions to be provided on Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: Late submission will not be possible as the Quizzes are due in the tutorials.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
Students work in groups to create an infographic and companion page explaining (i) an economic policy problem, (ii) a policy to address the problem (iii) how the policy solves the problem.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submissions instructions to be provided on Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: Late submission will not be possible as the Quizzes are due in the tutorials.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
Groups provide written feedback on other group’s submission assessing both the infographic and companion page.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submissions instructions to be provided on Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: Late submission will not be possible as the Quizzes are due in the tutorials.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
Final submission of the Infographic and companion page, including a response letter explaining how the feedback is addressed in the revision.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submissions instructions to be provided on Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: Late submission will not be possible as the Quizzes are due in the tutorials.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.due_date:
7/05/2026 - 29/05/2026

Three in-tutorial quizzes in weeks 10, 12 and 13. Best two out of three quizzes are considered to compute the mark.

Refer to Blackboard announcements for details.
assessments.task_description:
Students will have 20-30 minutes to complete 2-3 questions on paper.

In this assessment, you will solve problems that demonstrate your understanding of key concepts and your ability to apply them. The task is designed to assess your skills in analysis and to support your development in these capabilities. Completing this assessment will help you build practical skills that you can carry into future coursework.

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submission in paper during tutorial to the tutor.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: Late submission will not be possible as the Quizzes are due in the tutorials.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
